channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024030590
item.description:
Report X-2024030590

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A WET PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE WAS WET DUE TO BAGS OF ICE INSIDE THE BOX THAT HAD MELTED COMPROMISING THE INTEGRITY OF THE BOX. THE REGULAR ICE WAS COOLING 24 X 13 OUNCE AEROSOLS CANS OF FAVORITE DAY WHIPPED DAIRY TOPPING. THE CAN INDICATES THE CONTENTS ARE UNDER PRESSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Member of our management team went to our unloads where the leaking hazmat was discovered. DescribePack: The box was wet from the leaking contents, The label itself was starting to fade away due to the strong chemical inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed the package inside of a lined tote and took it to our hood vent to help stop the horrible smell to stop spreading.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was located on the unload side. Package was placed in a lined hazmat bag and placed inside of tote. Package was brought to the QA area for further investigation. DescribePack: Upon further investigation, it was discovered that the bottom of the bottles was leaking and leaked inside of the package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a lined hazmat bag and placed inside of a tote

item.title: Report E-2024030195
item.description:
Report E-2024030195

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RELIABLE TANK LINE, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Post-incident inspection revealed a malfunctioning vapor recovery system on the 87E10 storage tank at the delivery location. The spill was the result of the delivery driver improperly disconnecting the delivery coupling while the system was pressurized. The pressure equalized after 4-5 minutes and the overfill subsided. Local EMS responded as did a professional response team to mitigate the effects of the release. The released gasoline entered the stormwater retention basin at the delivery site and just into the outflow area on the property. The spill did not leave the premises. No surface water or ground water was impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024020262
item.description:
Report E-2024020262

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: AURORA
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/10/2024, at 02:34 hours, personnel at the CSX Public Safety Coordination Center, were advised that the L23409 had derailed fourteen cars on the Norfolk Southernâ€™s railroad in Aurora, NC. As a result of the derailment, SUJX 80046 a tank car load of Sulfur, Molten, sustained a breach to the tank head and released approximately one thousand pounds of Sulfur. Per operating agreement, Norfolk Southern personnel, and their emergency response contractors, responded to the incident and remediated the release.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection found the plastic cracked bottom of the container leading to powder leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials pail awaiting disposition.

  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee unloading a wood pallet and found that a protruding nail punctured the bottom edge of pail. Pail was then removed and placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2024030164
item.description:
Report E-2024030164

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: . It was reported that an unknown amount of Alpha Methyl Styrene (UN2303) released from 1 55 Gal DM due to a forklift puncture The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 85 gallon DF contains product only was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
